cards.name: Solemn Offering
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain 4 life.
cards.flavor:
"A relic donation is suggested."
"The suggestion is mandatory."
—Temple signs

rulings.text: If the targeted permanent is an illegal target by the time Solemn Offering would resolve, the entire spell doesn't resolve. You won't gain any life.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain 4 life.

cards.name: Soul Warden
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: "One does not question the size or shape of the grains of sand in an hourglass. Nor do I question the temperament of the souls under my guidance."

rulings.text: Does not trigger on a card on the battlefield being changed into a creature.
The ability will not trigger on itself entering the battlefield, but it will trigger on any other creature that is put onto the battlefield at the same time.
Two Soul Wardens entering the battlefield at the same time will each cause the other's ability to trigger.
The life gain is mandatory.

cards.originalText: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Stormfront Pegasus
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"At summer's end, the pegasus herd stampedes across the sky. Their silent footfalls taunt the clouds and bid the rains to come."
—Stormfront fable
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Tempest of Light
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments.
cards.flavor: "Let everything return to its true nature, so that destiny may take its course."
cards.originalText: Destroy all enchantments.

cards.name: Undead Slayer
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Exile target Skeleton, Vampire, or Zombie.
cards.flavor: "My motive is not vengeance but mercy. I deliver the soulless back to their severed souls."

rulings.text: Undead Slayer's ability must target a permanent (not a card in the graveyard) with at least one of the listed creature types.

cards.originalText: {W}, {T}: Exile target Skeleton, Vampire, or Zombie.

cards.name: Veteran Armorsmith
cards.text: Other Soldier creatures you control get +0/+1.
cards.flavor: "Courage is a proud and gleaming shield. It does not bend or hide from sight. To fight with courage, we must forge in steel."
cards.originalText: Other Soldier creatures you control get +0/+1.

cards.name: Veteran Swordsmith
cards.text: Other Soldier creatures you control get +1/+0.
cards.flavor: "Truth is a straight, keen edge. There are no soft angles or rounded edges. To fight for truth, we must forge in steel."
cards.originalText: Other Soldier creatures you control get +1/+0.

cards.name: Wall of Faith
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{W}: Wall of Faith gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"This is a fine suit, armorsmith. I will be safe from harm. If only you could forge rings to mail the rest of my people . . ."
—Lord Hilneth
cards.originalText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{W}: Wall of Faith gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: White Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)
cards.originalText:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)

cards.name: Air Elemental
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor:
"The East Wind, an interloper in the dominions of Westerly Weather, is an impassive-faced tyrant with a sharp poniard held behind his back for a treacherous stab."
—Joseph Conrad, The Mirror of the Sea
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Alluring Siren
cards.text: {T}: Target creature an opponent controls attacks you this turn if able.
cards.flavor:
"The ground polluted floats with human gore,
And human carnage taints the dreadful shore
Fly swift the dangerous coast: let every ear
Be stopp'd against the song! 'tis death to hear!"
—Homer, The Odyssey, trans. Pope

rulings.text: After the ability resolves, the targeted creature attacks you only if it's able to do so as that turn's declare attackers step begins. If, at that time, the creature is tapped, is affected by a spell or ability that says it can't attack, or is affected by "summoning sickness," it can't attack. If there's a cost associated with having that creature attack, its controller isn't forced to pay that cost, so the creature doesn't have to attack in that case either.
If the targeted creature would be able to attack either you or a planeswalker you control, it must attack you, not the planeswalker.
Activating the ability during your opponent's turn after attackers have been declared will have no effect. The same is true if you activate the ability during your own turn.

cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature an opponent controls attacks you this turn if able.

cards.name: Cancel
cards.text: Counter target spell.
cards.originalText: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Clone
cards.text: You may have Clone enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: The shapeshifter mimics with a twin's esteem and a mirror's cruelty.

rulings.text: If the chosen creature is copying something else (for example, if the chosen creature is another Clone), then your Clone enters the battlefield as whatever the chosen creature copied.
If the chosen creature is a token, Clone copies the original characteristics of that token as stated by the effect that put it onto the battlefield. Clone is not a token.

Any enters-the-battlefield abilities of the copied creature will trigger when Clone enters the battlefield. Any "as [this creature] enters the battlefield" or "[this creature] enters the battlefield with" abilities of the chosen creature will also work.
If the chosen creature has {X} in its mana cost (such as Protean Hydra), X is considered to be zero.

Clone copies exactly what was printed on the original creature and nothing more (unless that creature is copying something else or is a token; see below). It doesn't copy whether that creature is tapped or untapped, whether it has any counters on it or Auras attached to it, or any non-copy effects that have changed its power, toughness, types, color, or so on.
If Clone somehow enters the battlefield at the same time as another creature, Clone can't become a copy of that creature. You may choose only a creature that's already on the battlefield.
You can choose not to copy anything. In that case, Clone enters the battlefield as a 0/0 Shapeshifter creature, and is probably put into the graveyard immediately.
Clone's ability doesn't target the chosen creature.

cards.originalText: You may have Clone enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield.

cards.name: Convincing Mirage
cards.text:
Enchant land
As Convincing Mirage enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is the chosen type.
cards.flavor: "Where are we? You must learn to ask more useful questions than that."

rulings.text: The affected land loses its existing land types and any abilities printed on it. It becomes the chosen basic land type and now has the ability to tap to add one mana of the appropriate color to your mana pool. Convincing Mirage's ability doesn't change the affected land's name or whether it's legendary or basic.

cards.originalText:
Enchant land
As Convincing Mirage enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is the chosen type.

cards.name: Coral Merfolk
cards.flavor: Merfolk are best known for their subtle magic. But those who try to fight them in their own territory quickly realize that merfolk are hardly defenseless on the field of battle.

cards.name: Disorient
cards.text: Target creature gets -7/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"If it has a brain, even a primitive one, we can most surely scramble it."
—Garild, merfolk mage

rulings.text: A creature with power 0 or less assigns no combat damage. (It doesn't assign a negative amount of combat damage.)

cards.originalText: Target creature gets -7/-0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Divination
cards.text: Draw two cards.
cards.flavor:
"The key to unlocking this puzzle is within you."
—Doriel, mentor of Mistral Isle
cards.originalText: Draw two cards.

cards.name: Djinn of Wishes
cards.text:
Flying
Djinn of Wishes enters the battlefield with three wish counters on it.
{2}{U}{U}, Remove a wish counter from Djinn of Wishes: Reveal the top card of your library. You may play that card without paying its mana cost. If you don't, exile it.

rulings.text: If you wish to play the exiled card, you must play it while the last ability of Djinn of Wishes is resolving. You can't play it later in the turn. A spell cast this way may be cast at a time you normally wouldn't be able to cast a spell of that type, but other restrictions (such as "Cast this spell only during combat") are enforced.
If the revealed card is a land, you can play it only if it's your turn and you haven't yet played a land this turn.

If you cast a spell "without paying its mana cost," you can't choose to cast it for any alternative costs. You can, however, pay additional costs, such as kicker costs. If the card has any mandatory additional costs, such as that of Tormenting Voice, those must be paid to cast the card.
If a spell has {X} in its mana cost, you must choose 0 as the value of X when casting it without paying its mana cost.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Djinn of Wishes enters the battlefield with three wish counters on it.
{2}{U}{U}, Remove a wish counter from Djinn of Wishes: Reveal the top card of your library. You may play that card without paying its mana cost. If you don't, exile it.

cards.name: Essence Scatter
cards.text: Counter target creature spell.
cards.flavor: Some wizards compete not to summon the most interesting creatures, but to create the most interesting aftereffects when a summons goes awry.

rulings.text: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact or enchantment. Older cards of type summon are also creature spells.

cards.originalText: Counter target creature spell.

cards.name: Fabricate
cards.text: Search your library for an artifact card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"I'm one masterpiece away from ruling this pathetic world."
—Saldrath, master artificer
cards.originalText: Search your library for an artifact card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Flashfreeze
cards.text: Counter target red or green spell.
cards.flavor:
"Your downfall was not your ignorance, your weakness, or your hubris, but your warm blood."
—Heidar, Rimewind master
cards.originalText: Counter target red or green spell.

cards.name: Hive Mind
cards.text: Whenever a player casts an instant or sorcery spell, each other player copies that spell. Each of those players may choose new targets for their copy.
cards.flavor:
"All consciousness is one, separated only by a thin veil of the physical."
—Jace Beleren

rulings.text: Hive Mind's effect is mandatory. Each other player must copy the spell whether they want to or not.
Hive Mind will copy any instant or sorcery spell, not just one with targets.

If a player casts an instant or sorcery spell, Hive Mind's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Hive Mind's ability will resolve first. When it does, it creates a number of copies of that spell equal to the number of players in the game minus one. First the player whose turn it is (or, if that's the player who cast the original spell, the player to that player's left) puts their copy on the stack, choosing new targets for it if they like. Then each other player in turn order does the same. The last copy put on the stack will be the first one that resolves. (Note that the very last thing to happen is that the original spell resolves.)
The copies that Hive Mind's ability creates are created on the stack, so they're not "cast." Abilities that trigger when a player casts a spell (like Hive Mind's ability itself) won't trigger.

Each copy will have the same targets as the spell it's copying unless its controller chooses new ones. That player may change any number of the targets, including all of them or none of them. If, for one of the targets, the player can't choose a new legal target, then it remains unchanged (even if the current target is illegal).
If the spell that's copied is modal (that is, it says "Choose one —" or the like), the copy will have the same mode. A player can't choose a different one.
If the spell that's copied has an X whose value was determined as it was cast (like Earthquake does), the copy has the same value of X.

A copy's controller can't choose to pay any additional costs for the copy. However, effects based on any additional costs that were paid for the original spell are copied as though those same costs were paid for the copy too.

If a copy says that it affects "you," it affects the controller of the copy, not the controller of the original spell. Similarly, if a copy says that it affects an "opponent," it affects an opponent of the copy's controller, not an opponent of the original spell's controller.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player casts an instant or sorcery spell, each other player copies that spell. Each of those players may choose new targets for his or her copy.

cards.name: Horned Turtle
cards.flavor: It's a mistake to say turtles hide in their shells. They merely need time to contemplate how best to bite your head off.

cards.name: Ice Cage
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
When enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, destroy Ice Cage.

rulings.text: If the enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, Ice Cage's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell or ability. Ice Cage's ability will resolve (causing Ice Cage to be destroyed) first.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
When enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, destroy Ice Cage.

cards.name: Illusionary Servant
cards.text:
Flying
When Illusionary Servant becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.
cards.flavor:
"Illusion is a handy but fragile medium. Use it only in a pinch, or against the dim-witted."
—Jace Beleren

rulings.text: If Illusionary Servant becomes the target of a spell or ability, Illusionary Servant's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell or ability. Illusionary Servant's ability will resolve (causing it to be sacrificed) first. Unless the spell or ability has another target, it will then be countered when it tries to resolve for having no legal targets.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Illusionary Servant becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.

cards.name: Jace Beleren
cards.text:
+2: Each player draws a card.
−1: Target player draws a card.
−10: Target player puts the top twenty cards of their library into their graveyard.

rulings.text: If there are fewer than twenty cards in the targeted player's library, that player puts all the cards from their library into their graveyard.

cards.originalText:
+2: Each player draws a card.
-1: Target player draws a card.
-10: Target player puts the top twenty cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Jump
cards.text: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Humanity has always envied the power of flight. So we took it."
—Scytha, aeromage

rulings.text: To work as an evasion ability, an attacking creature must already have flying when the declare blockers step begins. Once a creature has become blocked, giving it flying won't change that.

cards.originalText: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Levitation
cards.text: Creatures you control have flying.
cards.flavor: The horses of Scytha's army must be well trained. A thrown rider would fall miles before meeting the ground.
cards.originalText: Creatures you control have flying.

cards.name: Merfolk Looter
cards.text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: Merfolk don't always know what they're looking for, but they're certain once they find it.

rulings.text: You can't do anything in between drawing a card and discarding a card, including casting or cycling the card you drew.

foreignNames.name: マーフォークの物あさり

cards.originalText: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.

cards.name: Merfolk Sovereign
cards.text:
Other Merfolk creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Target Merfolk creature can't be blocked this turn.
cards.flavor: "The sharks envy our ferocity. The eels envy our cunning."

rulings.text: To have any effect, Merfolk Sovereign's activated ability must be activated before the declare blockers step begins. Once a Merfolk has become blocked, activating Merfolk Sovereign's ability won't change that.

cards.originalText:
Other Merfolk creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Target Merfolk creature is unblockable this turn.

cards.name: Mind Control
cards.text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
"Why fight the body when you can dominate the mind that rules it?"
—Jace Beleren

rulings.text: Gaining control of a creature doesn't cause you gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.

cards.name: Mind Spring
cards.text: Draw X cards.
cards.flavor: Fragments of thought refract and multiply, surging in a geyser of dizzying insight.
cards.originalText: Draw X cards.

cards.name: Negate
cards.text: Counter target noncreature spell.
cards.flavor: Masters of the arcane savor a delicious irony. Their study of deep and complex arcana leads to such a simple end: the ability to say merely yes or no.

rulings.text: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact or enchantment. Older cards of type summon are also creature spells.

cards.originalText: Counter target noncreature spell.

cards.name: Phantom Warrior
cards.text: Phantom Warrior can't be blocked.
cards.flavor:
"The construction of a defense is not accomplished by adding bricks."
—Jace Beleren
cards.originalText: Phantom Warrior is unblockable.

cards.name: Polymorph
cards.text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller reveals cards from the top of their library until they reveal a creature card. The player puts that card onto the battlefield, then shuffles all other cards revealed this way into their library.

rulings.text: If there are no creatures in the player's library, then the target creature is still destroyed, you see all the cards in that player's library, and then they shuffle and continue play.
If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Polymorph would resolve, the entire spell doesn't resolve. Nothing else happens.
If there are no creature cards in the player's library, all the cards in that library are revealed, then the library is shuffled. (The targeted creature remains destroyed.)
A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.
If the targeted creature has indestructible, it's still a legal target — it just isn't destroyed. The rest of Polymorph's effect happens as normal.

cards.originalText: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a creature card. The player puts that card onto the battlefield, then shuffles all other cards revealed this way into his or her library.

cards.name: Ponder
cards.text:
Look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order. You may shuffle your library.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Tomorrow belongs to those who prepare for it today.

rulings.text: If you choose to shuffle your library, that includes the three cards you just looked at and put back on top of it.

cards.originalText:
Look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order. You may shuffle your library.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Sage Owl
cards.text:
Flying
When Sage Owl enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
cards.flavor: Some owls house the souls of archmages of ages past.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Sage Owl enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

cards.name: Serpent of the Endless Sea
cards.text:
Serpent of the Endless Sea's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Islands you control.
Serpent of the Endless Sea can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

foreignNames.name: Serpent de la Mer sans fin

cards.originalText:
Serpent of the Endless Sea's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Islands you control.
Serpent of the Endless Sea can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

cards.name: Sleep
cards.text: Tap all creatures target player controls. Those creatures don't untap during that player's next untap step.
cards.flavor:
"I give them dreams so wondrous that they hesitate to return to the world of the conscious."
—Garild, merfolk mage

rulings.text: The second part of Sleep's ability affects all creatures the targeted player controls as Sleep resolves, not only the ones that Sleep actually caused to become tapped.

cards.originalText: Tap all creatures target player controls. Those creatures don't untap during that player's next untap step.

cards.name: Snapping Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Foul-tempered, poorly trained, and mule-stubborn, the drake is the perfect test of the master's will.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Sphinx Ambassador
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Sphinx Ambassador deals combat damage to a player, search that player's library for a card, then that player chooses a card name. If you searched for a creature card that doesn't have that name, you may put it onto the battlefield under your control. Then that player shuffles their library.

rulings.text: You may search for any card, not just a creature card. Of course, if you choose a noncreature card, you won't be able to put it onto the battlefield no matter what card the player names.
Once you've chosen a card during your search, you must clearly indicate which card you've chosen (preferably without showing the front of that card to the player!). Then the player names a card.

After the player names a card, check if the card you chose has that name. If it doesn't, but it's a creature card, you may put it onto the battlefield. If you don't want to put that card onto the battlefield, it's not a creature card, or it does have the name the player said, it simply stays in that player's library without ever being revealed. The player then shuffles their library, including that card.
A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Sphinx Ambassador deals combat damage to a player, search that player's library for a card, then that player names a card. If you searched for a creature card that isn't the named card, you may put it onto the battlefield under your control. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Telepathy
cards.text: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.
cards.flavor:
"The most disappointing thing about learning telepathy is finding out how boring people really are."
—Teferi, fourth-level student
cards.originalText: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.

cards.name: Time Warp
cards.text: Target player takes an extra turn after this one.
cards.flavor: Just when you thought you'd survived the first wave.

rulings.text: If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

cards.originalText: Target player takes an extra turn after this one.

cards.name: Tome Scour
cards.text: Target player puts the top five cards of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor: Genius is overrated, especially when it's someone else's.

rulings.text: If there are fewer than five cards in the targeted player's library, that player puts all the cards from their library into their graveyard.

cards.originalText: Target player puts the top five cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Traumatize
cards.text: Target player puts the top half of their library, rounded down, into their graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"The educated mind is heavy with lore and knowledge. It's also the most likely to collapse under its own weight."
—Ambassador Laquatus

rulings.text: The player can put the cards in their graveyard in any order they choose.

cards.originalText: Target player puts the top half of his or her library, rounded down, into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Twincast
cards.text: Copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
cards.flavor: Imitation is the most dangerous form of flattery.

rulings.text: You can't choose to pay any additional costs for the copy. However, effects based on any additional costs paid for the targeted spell are copied as though those same costs were paid for the copy too.
Twincast copies any text spliced onto the targeted spell, but you can't splice additional text onto the copy.
Twincast can target (and copy) any instant or sorcery spell, not just one with targets. It doesn't matter who controls it.

As Twincast resolves, it creates a copy of a spell. That copy is created on the stack, so it's not "cast." Abilities that trigger when a player casts a spell won't trigger. The copy will then resolve like a normal spell, after players get a chance to cast spells and activate abilities.

The copy will have the same targets as the spell it's copying unless you choose new ones. You may change any number of the targets, including all of them or none of them. If, for one of the targets, you can't choose a new legal target, then it remains unchanged (even if the current target is illegal).
If the spell Twincast copies is modal (that is, it says "Choose one —" or the like), the copy will have the same mode. You can't choose a different one.
If the spell Twincast copies has an X whose value was determined as it was cast (like Earthquake does), the copy has the same value of X.

If the copy says that it affects "you," it affects the controller of the copy, not the controller of the original spell. Similarly, if the copy says that it affects an "opponent," it affects an opponent of the copy's controller, not an opponent of the original spell's controller.

cards.originalText: Copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.

cards.name: Unsummon
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Mages routinely summon creatures from the Æther. It's only fair that they occasionally throw one back.
cards.originalText: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Wall of Frost
cards.text:
Defender
Whenever Wall of Frost blocks a creature, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
cards.flavor:
"I welcome it. The pasture is cleared of weeds and the wolves are frozen solid."
—Lumi, goatherd

rulings.text: Wall of Frost's ability tracks the creature, not the creature's controller. That is, if the creature changes controllers before its first controller's next untap step, then it won't untap during its new controller's next untap step.

If the creature isn't tapped during its controller's next untap step (perhaps because it was untapped by a spell), Wall of Frost's ability has no effect at that time. It won't try to keep the creature tapped on subsequent turns.

cards.originalText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Wall of Frost blocks a creature, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Wind Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: A smaller cousin to the dragon, drakes are often seen at the side of powerful wizards who use them as airborne eyes and ears.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Zephyr Sprite
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: "I've never understood why so many beings lumber around on the ground. There are three dimensions, yet they use only two."
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Acolyte of Xathrid
cards.text: {1}{B}, {T}: Target player loses 1 life.
cards.flavor: Like all priests, she gives her blessings only to those truly worthy of them.

foreignNames.name: ザスリッドの見習い僧

cards.originalText: {1}{B}, {T}: Target player loses 1 life.

cards.name: Assassinate
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavor:
"This is how wars are won—not with armies of soldiers but with a single knife blade, artfully placed."
—Yurin, royal assassin
cards.originalText: Destroy target tapped creature.

cards.name: Black Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)
cards.originalText:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)

cards.name: Bog Wraith
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: She died in this swamp, and so will you.
cards.originalText: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

cards.name: Cemetery Reaper
cards.text:
Other Zombie creatures you control get +1/+1.
{2}{B}, {T}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
cards.flavor: Every grave cradles a recruit.

rulings.text: Cemetery Reaper grants +1/+1 to all other Zombie creatures you control, not just the ones its ability puts onto the battlefield.

The creature card in a graveyard is exiled as part of the activated ability's effect, not as a cost. If that card has left the graveyard by the time the ability would resolve, the ability doesn't resolve and you don't get a Zombie token.

cards.originalText:
Other Zombie creatures you control get +1/+1.
{2}{B}, {T}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Child of Night
cards.text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
cards.flavor: A vampire enacts vengeance on the entire world, claiming her debt two tiny pinpricks at a time.
cards.originalText: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Consume Spirit
cards.text:
Spend only black mana on X.
Consume Spirit deals X damage to any target and you gain X life.

rulings.text: The amount of life you gain is equal to the number chosen for X, not the amount of damage Consume Spirit deals (in case some of it is prevented).
If the targeted permanent or player is an illegal target by the time Consume Spirit would resolve, the entire spell doesn't resolve. You won't gain any life.

cards.originalText:
Spend only black mana on X. 
Consume Spirit deals X damage to target creature or player and you gain X life.

cards.name: Deathmark
cards.text: Destroy target green or white creature.
cards.flavor: Even the noblest of intentions and strongest of wills inevitably crumble into dust.
cards.originalText: Destroy target green or white creature.

cards.name: Diabolic Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The wise always keep an ear open to the whispers of power.
cards.originalText: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Disentomb
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor:
"Stop complaining. You can rest when you're dead. Oh—sorry."
—Liliana Vess

rulings.text: A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.originalText: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Doom Blade
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature.
cards.flavor: The void is without substance but cuts like steel.
cards.originalText: Destroy target nonblack creature.

cards.name: Dread Warlock
cards.text: Dread Warlock can't be blocked except by black creatures.
cards.flavor: "I don't know who to pity more: those who flee from my presence or the damned who can withstand it."
cards.originalText: Dread Warlock can't be blocked except by black creatures.

cards.name: Drudge Skeletons
cards.text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor:
"The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, never surrender, and don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."
—Nevinyrral, Necromancer's Handbook
cards.originalText: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.name: Duress
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor:
"Don't worry. I'm not going to deprive you of all your secrets. Just your most precious one."
—Liliana Vess
cards.originalText: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Gravedigger
cards.text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Oddly, no one questioned the Cabal's wisdom in hiring a zombie to work at the cemetery.

rulings.text: A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.originalText: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Haunting Echoes
cards.text: Exile all cards from target player's graveyard other than basic land cards. For each card exiled this way, search that player's library for all cards with the same name as that card and exile them. Then that player shuffles their library.

rulings.text: While you're searching the player's library, you don't have to find all the cards with the same name as an exiled card if you don't want to. You can leave any number of them in that player's library.

cards.originalText: Exile all cards from target player's graveyard other than basic land cards. For each card exiled this way, search that player's library for all cards with the same name as that card and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Howling Banshee
cards.text:
Flying
When Howling Banshee enters the battlefield, each player loses 3 life.
cards.flavor: Villagers cloaked the town in magical silence, but their ears still bled.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Howling Banshee enters the battlefield, each player loses 3 life.

cards.name: Hypnotic Specter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.
cards.flavor: Its victims are known by their eyes: shattered vessels leaking broken dreams.

rulings.text: The ability triggers even if the Specter's damage is being redirected to an opponent. It does not trigger if damage that would have been dealt to the opponent is redirected to a nonopponent player or a creature, or if the damage is prevented.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.

cards.name: Kelinore Bat
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: The nesting bats of Kelinore sleep soundly while the sun passes, nestled among their grisly collections.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Liliana Vess
cards.text:
+1: Target player discards a card.
−2: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
−8: Put all creature cards from all graveyards onto the battlefield under your control.

rulings.text: A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.originalText:
+1: Target player discards a card.
-2: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
-8: Put all creature cards in all graveyards onto the battlefield under your control.

cards.name: Looming Shade
cards.text: {B}: Looming Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Its form never rests, propelled by some undetectable gale from beyond the gloom.
cards.originalText: {B}: Looming Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Megrim
cards.text: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.
cards.flavor:
"It's a vicious circle. Stress breeds pain. Pain breeds stress. It's simply beautiful, wouldn't you agree?"
—Vradeen, vampire nocturnus
cards.originalText: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.

cards.name: Mind Rot
cards.text: Target player discards two cards.
cards.flavor:
"The beauty of mental attacks is that your victims never remember them."
—Volrath
cards.originalText: Target player discards two cards.

cards.name: Mind Shatter
cards.text: Target player discards X cards at random.
cards.flavor: Dark thoughts hatch and twist within the mind, straining to take wing.
cards.originalText: Target player discards X cards at random.

cards.name: Nightmare
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
cards.flavor: The thunder of its hooves beats dreams into despair.

rulings.text: If you control 0 swamps, then the Nightmare has 0 toughness and will be put into its owner's graveyard as a state-based action right before the next player gains priority.
Nightmare's power and toughness changes as the number of Swamps you control changes.
The ability that defines Nightmare's power and toughness works everywhere, not just on the battlefield.
Nightmare's ability counts all lands you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.

cards.name: Relentless Rats
cards.text:
Relentless Rats gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield named Relentless Rats.
A deck can have any number of cards named Relentless Rats.

rulings.text: The second ability of Relentless Rats lets you ignore the "four-of" rule. It doesn't let you ignore format legality. For example, during a Masters 25 Limited event, you can't add Relentless Rats from your personal collection.

cards.originalText:
Relentless Rats gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield named Relentless Rats.
A deck can have any number of cards named Relentless Rats.

cards.name: Rise from the Grave
cards.text: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. That creature is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.
cards.flavor:
"Death is no excuse for disobedience."
—Liliana Vess

rulings.text: Rise from the Grave doesn't overwrite any previous colors or types. Rather, it adds another color and another subtype.
If the creature is normally colorless, it will simply become black. It can't be both black and colorless.

A later effect that changes the affected creature's colors will overwrite that part of Rise from the Grave's effect; the creature will be only the new color. The same is true about an effect that changes the affected creature's types or subtypes.

cards.originalText: Put target creature card in a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. That creature is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.

cards.name: Royal Assassin
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavor: Trained in the arts of stealth, royal assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.

rulings.text: Can't target itself because you choose the target before you tap him. At that time he is not yet a legal target.
If the creature is no longer tapped when the Assassin's ability resolves, then the ability doesn't resolve.

cards.originalText: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.

cards.name: Sanguine Bond
cards.text: Whenever you gain life, target opponent loses that much life.
cards.flavor:
"Blood is constant. Every drop I drink, someone must bleed."
—Vradeen, vampire nocturnus

rulings.text: Sanguine Bond's ability triggers just once for each life-gaining event, whether it's 1 life from Soul Warden or 8 life from Tendrils of Corruption.

cards.originalText: Whenever you gain life, target opponent loses that much life.

cards.name: Sign in Blood
cards.text: Target player draws two cards and loses 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"You know I accept only one currency here, and yet you have sought me out. Why now do you hesitate?"
—Xathrid demon
cards.originalText: Target player draws two cards and loses 2 life.

cards.name: Soul Bleed
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player loses 1 life.
cards.flavor: Whether the end comes swift or slow, it always comes too soon.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player loses 1 life.

cards.name: Tendrils of Corruption
cards.text: Tendrils of Corruption deals X damage to target creature and you gain X life, where X is the number of Swamps you control.
cards.flavor: Darkness doesn't always send its minions to do its dirty work.

rulings.text: The amount of life you gain is equal to the number of Swamps you control, not the amount of damage Tendrils of Corruption deals (in case some of it is prevented).
If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Tendrils of Corruption would resolve, the entire spell doesn't resolve. You won't gain any life.

cards.originalText: Tendrils of Corruption deals X damage to target creature and you gain X life, where X is the number of Swamps you control.

cards.name: Underworld Dreams
cards.text: Whenever an opponent draws a card, Underworld Dreams deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.flavor:
"In the drowsy dark cave of the mind, dreams build their nest with fragments dropped from day's caravan."
—Rabindranath Tagore

rulings.text: If multiple cards are drawn at once, this card triggers once for each card drawn.
In a multi-player game, it affects all opponents.

cards.originalText: Whenever an opponent draws a card, Underworld Dreams deals 1 damage to him or her.

cards.name: Unholy Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.
cards.flavor:
"Born under the moon, the second child will stumble on temptation and seek power in the dark places of the heart."
—Codex of the Constellari
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.

cards.name: Vampire Aristocrat
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Vampire Aristocrat gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "I admit, I am a creature of the city. The sights, the nightly excitement, the abundance of fine drink . . ."

rulings.text: You can sacrifice Vampire Aristocrat to activate its own ability, but it won't be around to get the bonus.

If you sacrifice an attacking or blocking creature during the declare blockers step, it won't deal combat damage. If you wait until the combat damage step, but that creature has been dealt lethal damage, it'll be destroyed before you get a chance to sacrifice it.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Vampire Aristocrat gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Vampire Nocturnus
cards.text:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
As long as the top card of your library is black, Vampire Nocturnus and other Vampire creatures you control get +2/+1 and have flying.
cards.flavor: "Your life will set with the sun."

rulings.text: To work as an evasion ability, an attacking creature must already have flying when the declare blockers step begins. Once a creature has become blocked, giving it flying won't change that.
The top card of your library isn't in your hand, so you can't suspend it, cycle it, discard it, or activate any of its activated abilities.
If the top card of your library changes while you're casting a spell or activating an ability, the new top card won't be revealed until you finish casting that spell or activating that ability.
When playing with the top card of your library revealed, if an effect tells you to draw several cards, reveal each one before you draw it.
If the top card of your library is black, Vampire Nocturnus will give itself +2/+1 and flying even if it's somehow not a Vampire.

cards.originalText:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
As long as the top card of your library is black, Vampire Nocturnus and other Vampire creatures you control get +2/+1 and have flying.

cards.name: Wall of Bone
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.originalText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.name: Warpath Ghoul
cards.flavor: The battle was over, but the carnage continued for days.

foreignNames.name: Goule sur le sentier de la guerre

cards.name: Weakness
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.
cards.flavor: "For strength to have any meaning, there must also be . . . you."
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.

cards.name: Xathrid Demon
cards.text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Xathrid Demon, then each opponent loses life equal to the sacrificed creature's power. If you can't sacrifice a creature, tap Xathrid Demon and you lose 7 life.

rulings.text: When the ability resolves, if you control any other creatures, you must sacrifice one of them. You lose life only if no creature can be sacrificed.

If you have two Xathrid Demons, both abilities will trigger at the beginning of your upkeep. When the first Demon's ability resolves, you can sacrifice the second Demon to satisfy the requirement ("Sacrifice a creature other than Xathrid Demon" really means "Sacrifice a creature other than this creature"). When the second Demon's ability resolves, you must sacrifice another creature. If you can't (because the first Demon has somehow left the battlefield and you control no other creatures), you lose 7 life, regardless of whether the second Demon is still on the battlefield at this time.

cards.originalText:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Xathrid Demon, then each opponent loses life equal to the sacrificed creature's power. If you can't sacrifice a creature, tap Xathrid Demon and you lose 7 life.

cards.name: Zombie Goliath
cards.flavor:
"Phirax of Blood Ridge has sent a war giant at us? What, do I have to spell it out for you? Kill the giant, scoop out its skull, and drive it back to Blood Ridge. Honestly, what kind of necromancer minions are you?"
—Keren-Dur, necromancer lord

cards.name: Act of Treason
cards.text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)
cards.flavor:
"Rage courses in every heart, yearning to betray its rational prison."
—Sarkhan Vol

rulings.text: Act of Treason can target any creature, even one that's untapped or one you already control.
Gaining control of a creature doesn't cause you to gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it.

cards.originalText: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)

cards.name: Ball Lightning
cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ball Lightning.

rulings.text: The creature is sacrificed at the end of every turn in which it is on the battlefield. There is no choice about what turn to sacrifice it.

foreignNames.name: ボール・ライトニング

cards.originalText:
Trample (If this creature would deal enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it deal the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ball Lightning.

cards.name: Berserkers of Blood Ridge
cards.text: Berserkers of Blood Ridge attacks each combat if able.
cards.flavor: They take a blood oath to die in battle. So far none have failed to fulfill the promise.

rulings.text: If, during your declare attackers step, Berserkers of Blood Ridge is tapped, is affected by a spell or ability that says it can't attack, or is affected by "summoning sickness," then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having Berserkers of Blood Ridge attack, you aren't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.

cards.originalText: Berserkers of Blood Ridge attacks each turn if able.

cards.name: Bogardan Hellkite
cards.text:
Flash
Flying
When Bogardan Hellkite enters the battlefield, it deals 5 damage divided as you choose among any number of targets.

rulings.text: You choose how many targets Bogardan Hellkite's triggered ability has and how the damage is divided as you put the ability onto the stack. Each target must receive at least 1 damage.

If some of the creatures or players are illegal targets as Bogardan Hellkite's triggered ability tries to resolve, the original division of damage still applies and the damage that would have been dealt to the illegal targets is lost. It won't be dealt instead to a legal target.

foreignNames.name: ボガーダンのヘルカイト

cards.originalText:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying
When Bogardan Hellkite enters the battlefield, it deals 5 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Burning Inquiry
cards.text: Each player draws three cards, then discards three cards at random.
cards.flavor: Jariad burned the midnight oil, burned through scroll after scroll, and then burned down his laboratory.

rulings.text: First the player whose turn it is draws three cards, then each other player in turn order does so. Then the active player randomly chooses the three cards they will discard, then each other player in turn order does so. Then all the cards are discarded at the same time.
Each player must discard three cards, even a player that (for some reason) didn't actually draw three cards.

cards.originalText: Each player draws three cards, then discards three cards at random.

cards.name: Burst of Speed
cards.text: Creatures you control gain haste until end of turn. (They can attack and {T} even if they just came under your control.)
cards.flavor: Great generals inspire by example. Goblin chieftains inspire by electrifying the barracks.

rulings.text: Burst of Speed affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. It won't affect creatures that come under your control later in the turn.

cards.originalText: Creatures you control gain haste until end of turn. (They can attack and {T} even if they just came under your control.)

cards.name: Canyon Minotaur
cards.flavor:
"We'll scale these cliffs, traverse Brittle Bridge, and then fight our way down the volcanic slopes on the other side."
"Isn't the shortest route through the canyon?"
"Yes."
"So shouldn't we—"
"No."

cards.name: Capricious Efreet
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, choose target nonland permanent you control and up to two target nonland permanents you don't control. Destroy one of them at random.
cards.flavor: "You wish for great destruction? It is done, my master."

rulings.text: If Capricious Efreet is the only nonland permanent you control when its ability triggers, you'll have to target it.
You may target zero, one, or two nonland permanents you don't control.

You target between one and three permanents as you put the ability on the stack. You don't randomly choose which one will be destroyed until the ability resolves. If one of those permanents has become an illegal target by then, you randomly choose between the remaining ones.

As the ability resolves, there is no time to react between the time a permanent is chosen at random and the time it's destroyed. If you want to put a regeneration shield on one of those permanents, or sacrifice it for some effect, or anything else, you must do so before the ability resolves (and before you know which one of the permanents will be chosen at random).

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, choose target nonland permanent you control and up to two target nonland permanents you don't control. Destroy one of them at random.

cards.name: Chandra Nalaar
cards.text:
+1: Chandra Nalaar deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.
−X: Chandra Nalaar deals X damage to target creature.
−8: Chandra Nalaar deals 10 damage to target player or planeswalker and each creature that player or that planeswalker's controller controls.

rulings.text: To activate the second ability, you choose a value of X equal to or less than the number of loyalty counters on Chandra Nalaar. You may choose 0. You can't choose a negative number.

cards.originalText:
+1: Chandra Nalaar deals 1 damage to target player.
-X: Chandra Nalaar deals X damage to target creature.
-8: Chandra Nalaar deals 10 damage to target player and each creature he or she controls.
